intro: Piarimula, commonly known as the red spider lily, is a striking plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant red flowers that resemble spiders, hence its common name. The plant features strap-like, grassy leaves that emerge from a bulbous underground stem. Piarimula thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for gardeners. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long-lasting blooms and unique appearance.
